skill.name: dispatching-parallel-agents
skill.description: Use when facing 2+ independent tasks that can be worked on without shared state or sequential dependencies
skill.summary: Use when facing 2+ independent tasks that can be worked on without shared state or sequential depend...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown guidelines for dispatching parallel AI agents. No file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Dispatch Parallel Agents for Independent Tasks
content.value_statement: When multiple unrelated failures occur, investigating them sequentially wastes time. This skill provides a pattern for dispatching one AI agent per independent problem domain so they can work concurrently.
actual_capabilities: Decision tree for when to use parallel vs sequential agent dispatch
Guidelines for identifying independent problem domains
Best practices for creating focused agent prompts
Structure for self-contained agent tasks with clear goals
Pattern for reviewing and integrating parallel agent results
limitations: Does not actually dispatch agents - provides patterns and guidance only
Assumes user understands the problem domain to identify independent tasks
Does not integrate with any specific AI platform's agent dispatch API

use_cases.title: Debug Multiple Test Failures
use_cases.description: When 3+ test files fail with different root causes, dispatch one agent per file to investigate concurrently

use_cases.title: Parallelize Investigation Tasks
use_cases.description: Investigate failures in different subsystems simultaneously without shared state or sequential dependencies

use_cases.title: Scale Code Reviews
use_cases.description: Dispatch multiple agents to review different modules or features at the same time

prompt_templates.title: Basic Parallel Dispatch
prompt_templates.prompt: Investigate the failing tests in file X: understand the root cause and propose a fix. Return a summary of what you found and what you changed.

prompt_templates.title: Constrained Agent Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the 3 failing tests in [file]. Each test has a specific expectation. Identify if these are timing issues or actual bugs. Do NOT change production code elsewhere. Return a summary of root cause and fixes applied.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Agent Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: You are assigned to [specific subsystem]. Fix the failures in your assigned area only. Do not touch code outside this scope. Coordinate with other agents by documenting what you changed so we can verify no conflicts.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the changes made by Agent [N]. Check for conflicts with other changes. Run the full test suite. Verify the fixes work together and document any integration issues found.

output_examples.input: I have 6 failing tests across 3 different test files after a refactor. They seem unrelated.
output: Agent 1 dispatched to fix agent-tool-abort.test.ts (3 timing-related failures)
Agent 2 dispatched to fix batch-completion-behavior.test.ts (2 tool execution failures)
Agent 3 dispatched to fix tool-approval-race-conditions.test.ts (1 execution count failure)
All agents work concurrently → 3 problems solved in parallel

best_practices: Group failures by problem domain before dispatching - each agent should have one clear scope
Provide all context the agent needs in the prompt - test names, error messages, expected behavior
Set clear constraints: what the agent should NOT change and what output is expected
anti_patterns: Too broad prompts like 'Fix all the tests' - agents lose focus and context
No constraints - agents may refactor unrelated code causing more problems
Vague output expectations like 'Fix it' - you won't know what changed

faq.question: What AI tools support parallel agent dispatch?
faq.answer: Claude Code and most modern AI coding assistants support task-based workflows where multiple agents can be dispatched to work concurrently.

faq.question: How many agents can I dispatch at once?
faq.answer: This depends on your AI platform limits. Start with 2-3 parallel agents and scale based on your tool's capacity and task independence.

faq.question: How do I verify results don't conflict?
faq.answer: Run the full test suite after all agents return. Check that no agents edited the same files or introduced overlapping changes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this pattern?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only skill. No data is collected or transmitted. Your code and data remain local to your AI session.

faq.question: What if agents return conflicting changes?
faq.answer: Review each summary, identify the conflict, and resolve manually. The skill recommends spot-checking and running full test suites to catch conflicts.

faq.question: How is this different from sequential agent use?
faq.answer: Sequential agents wait for each other to finish. Parallel agents work simultaneously, reducing total time when problems are truly independent.
